Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Nigeria 
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" was brought out in booklet by the Enugu Publishing House of Nigeria on Sept. 19.
 The work, published on Oct. 2, Juche 84 (1995), serves as a great programme for the building of the WPK and its activity as it proudly reviews the glorious history of the WPK that explored a new road of building a revolutionary party in the era of independence under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and indicates the way of developing the Party into the eternal party of the President.

Preparatory Comm. for Celebrating 60th Birthday of WPK Formed in Indonesia
articles.content:
Preparatory Comm. for Celebrating 60th Birthday of WPK Formed in Indonesia 
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- An Indonesian Preparatory Committee for Celebrating the 60th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea was inaugurated by the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange on Sept. 23.
 Rachmawati Soekarnoputri, chairman of the association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee set a celebration period from Sept. 23 to Oct. 10 and decided to organize colorful functions in this period.

articles.title: Cambodian Committee for Celebrating 60th Birthday of WPK Inaugurated
articles.content:
Cambodian Committee for Celebrating 60th Birthday of WPK Inaugurated 
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- A Cambodian preparatory committee was formed in Phnom Penh on Sept. 22 with due ceremony in celebration of the 60th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea (October 10).
 Norodom Sirivuth, secretary general of the Funcinpec Party of Cambodia and deputy prime minister and co-minister of Interior of the Royal government, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the inaugural ceremony. 
 The preparatory committee decided to hold multifarious functions such as a seminar, film show, photo exhibition and press publication to introduce the exploits of President        Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in party building on the occasion.

KCTU Meeting Demands Better Labor Policy
articles.content:
KCTU Meeting Demands Better Labor Policy
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions reportedly held a rally in front of the building of the "National Assembly" on Sept. 22 in demand of a better labor policy.
 Ri Su Ho, chairman of the confederation, and others, addressing the rally, held that the regular session of the "National Assembly" should fairly examine the government policies concerning the guarantee of rights to the part-time workers, the withdrawal of the structural coordination, the stop to the suppression of the labor movement, the improvement of the minimum wage system and labor safety measures, etc.
 A resolution read out at the rally referred to the fact that the three labor rights had virtually been trampled down due to the authorities' pressure for the withdrawal from the trade union and their measures taken to close workshops and others, expressing the will to struggle for the improvement of the poor labor conditions to the last man.
 At the end of the rally its participants waged an all-night demonstration in front of the building of the NA.    
 The KCTU threatened to escalate its actions, including protest rally and tour of different parts of south Korea to stage its struggle.

articles.title: WPK Birthday Commemorated in Different Countries
articles.content:
WPK Birthday Commemorated in Different Countries
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- A lecture meeting and a photo exhibition were held by the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade    Kim Il Sung and film shows by the Secretariat of the Ugandan National Movement and the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of University of Kinshasa from Sept. 16 to 18 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
 Displayed at the venue of the functions were photos showing the proud successes achieved by the Korean people under the leadership of the WPK in last six decades. 
 Korean films including "'The Ever-Victorious Workers' Party of Korea', Grand Gymnastic and Artistic Performance Celebrating the 55th Anniversary of the WPK" were screened at the film shows.    
 Chairman of the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade    Kim Il Sung Balzor Singh Chauhan said in a lecture titled "The Source of the WPK Might " that it is the result of the outstanding and tested leadership of   Kim Jong Il that the WPK could demonstrate its dignity and might as the guiding force of the Korean people. 
 The deputy director of the Foreign Relations Department of the Secretariat of the Ugandan National Movement at the film show said that the party building experience of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il is a paragon the Ugandan National Movement and revolutionary parties of many countries should follow. 
 Meanwhile, a lecture titled "WPK demonstrating its might thanks to the outstanding leader" was given by the Secretariat of the Pan-African Movement on Sept. 19.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets South African Foreign Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets South African Foreign Ministry Delegation
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) --Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of South Africa led by Deputy Minister Aziz Goolam Hoosein Pahad at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Monday.  
 On hand were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Hyong Jun and officials concerned.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the head of the visiting delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of South Africa. 
 It was handed to President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly Kim Yong Nam Monday by Aziz Goolam Hoosein Pahad, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, who is leading the delegation.

articles.content:
Children�fs Scene of "Arirang"
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- "Grow with a Bright Smile", the Scene 2 of the Act 2 of the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" arouses a particular interest of the audience.
 Very impressive are the cute and skilful gymnastic movements of children showing their cheerful features healthily growing to be future pillars of Songun Korea.
 The performers, kindergarten and primary school children below ten years, skillfully carry out such movements as hand-standing, somersault, formation of human pyramid and rope-skipping to the tune of "The General and Children" and other songs. Most of the kindergarten children have come from the Changgwang Kindergarten, the kindergarten attached to the Pyongyang Textile Mill and Ponbu Kindergarten in Sinuiju.    
 In particular, when the lovely children wearing national costumes tactfully play rope skipping, the audience sends a thunderous applause to them, seized with joy.
 The background figures pictures and words reflecting the children�fs feeling, thus adding luster to the thematic content of the work.    
 "Arirang" performed by youth, school and kindergarten children of Songun Korea who are united with a single mind, is lauded as an extravaganza in the 21st century

articles.title: Talks Held between DPRK and Cuban Delegations
articles.content:
Talks Held between DPRK and Cuban Delegations
    Havana, September 24 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between the DPRK delegation headed by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and the Cuban delegation led by Carlos Rage, vice-president of the Council of State, in Havana on Sept. 24.
 At the talks both sides informed each other of the situation in their countries and exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly relations between the two countries and a series of issues of mutual concern.    
 Present there from the DPRK side were members of the DPRK delegation on a visit to Cuba and Pak Tong Chun, DPRK ambassador to Cuba, and from the Cuban side Marcos Rodriguez Costa, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.

articles.title: South Koreans' Tour of Pyongyang Begins
articles.content:
South Koreans' Tour of Pyongyang Begins
    Pyongyang, September 26 (KCNA) -- There has begun south Koreans' tour of Pyongyang.
 The first visiting group of the Headquarters of the Movement for Reunified Korea arrived here by air Monday.    
 The members of the group will tour various parts of the city and appreciate the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang".
